post_info.post_title: Have pregnant mothers parental duties towards their intrauterine offspring?

simone

It is to be hoped that women know enough about their own bodies and sexuality to recognize when they are pregnant.
 
 That if they realize they are pregnant and wish to be pregnant, that they have the means for obtaining basic prenatal care and the level of nutrition needed to sustain a successful pregnancy.
 
 However, those who would force women to be pregnant, refuse to recognize the responsibility that those who force pregnancy on women should take on in regard to prenatal care for the women so punished. 
 
 Also, I firmly believe that persons who force pregnancy on women should take full financial responsibility for the children they force women to carry to term and give birth to.
 
 So, people who force pregnancy upon women have a duty to take responsibility for those they have enslaved with their beliefs.
Chuz Life

False. Spain, USA, UK are examples.

 
 Did you bother to even look at the link?
 
 Western Europe has the lowest incendence of abortion in the world at 12 per 1000 women. North American has 21 per 1000 women. Latin America has 31 per 1000 women. Abortion rates are lower in developed countries (where it tends to be safe and legal, there is adequate health care, empowered women and less poverty) at 19 to every 1000 women (excluding Eastern Europe which has the highest incedence in the world, and where it is illegal and they only recently were given widespread education and access to birth control). In developing countries the incidence 29 to every 1000, or 30 to every 1000 if you include China.

 If I believe that a human being is being killed for no reason, I have to duty to stop it to protect the right to life all human beings have. If I believed it ok to own a slave, should I legally be able to own a slave? Why not? Why should your point of view that slavery is wrong interfere with my "choice"? The reason slavery was finally outlawed is because people realized that it was morally wrong to devalue human beings for being black, just as you devalue a fetus. Of course I believe slavery is wrong. Showing you a comparison.
 
 If that fetus is a human being, which it is biologically, you cannot debate that at all, then it has the right to life that all human beings have. You say that it does not matter if it is a human being, you say it has to be a person. Yet you have been unable to prove that a fetus is not a person. You say it has no mind but you have never proved it. Your arguments are empty.

The numbers on developing countries come from The World Health Organization.

No. They just have more than one thing that concerns them. Americans treasure freedom - you ideas are antithesis to that.

 
 Americans have killed lots of people, since Sioux to Iraquis. Intrauterine persons are only some of their victims.
Lakrite

Americans have killed lots of people, since Sioux to Iraquis. Intrauterine persons are only some of their victims.

 First Indians, then black slaves, and now fetuses. The selfishness some people have is disgusting. Attempting to justify this selfish attitude, people simply try to devalue the worth of what they are trying to abuse.
 
 Indians were called savages, uncivilized and incapable of doing anything in society.
 Black slaves were called less human because of their skin color. They were believed to be stupid, and unworthy of equal human rights.
 And now fetuses are called non-persons simply because they are not developed into a grown child.
 
 These moral wrongs all have a one thing in common that is exactly the same...by devaluing the indians/slaves/fetuses, someone else benefits. Settlers benefited by removing Indians. Plantation owners and the southern economy benefited with slaves. Women in removing fetuses benefit by not having to carry a child.
 
 The fact that someone else benefits from something does not make that something right. The majority of people believed it was "ok" to get rid of the Indian human beings. The majority believed that it was "right" to enslave black human beings. And now the majority believes that it is morally acceptable to kill a developing human being.
 The difference is simply in the "who". The moral wrong is the same: Selfishness and discrimination to those with less power.
 
 How can we call America the country of opportunity if millions of Americans are not even given the opportunity be born?
Cyberateos

Lakrite:
 
 I agree.
 
 For that reason, a true antiabortion campaign should not use imprecise terms such as "life". More intelligent terms such as "intrauterine human rights" or "fetal persons" should be used.
